text: The 2003 Country Music Association Awards, 37th Ceremony, was held on November 5, 2003 at the Grand Ole Opry House, Nashville, Tennessee, and hosted by CMA Award Winner, Vince Gill. Toby Keith lead the evening with 7 nominations, including Album of the Year, and Entertainer of the Year. Alan Jackson and Johnny Cash (posthumously) took home the most awards with 3 each. == Winners and Nominees == {| class="wikitable" ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Alan Jackson ** Brooks & Dunn ** Kenny Chesney ** Toby Keith ** Tim McGraw | valign="top" | *American IV: The Man Comes Around — Johnny Cash (posthumously awarded) **Home — Dixie Chicks **Man With a Memory — Joe Nichols **Tim McGraw and the Dancehall Doctors — Tim McGraw **Unleashed — Toby Keith |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Alan Jackson ** Kenny Chesney ** Toby Keith ** Tim McGraw ** Brad Paisley ** George Strait | valign="top" | * Martina McBride ** Terri Clark ** Alison Krauss ** Patty Loveless ** Dolly Parton |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Group of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Duo of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Rascal Flatts ** Alabama ** Diamond Rio ** Dixie Chicks ** Lonestar | valign="top" | * Brooks & Dunn ** Bellamy Brothers ** Montgomery Gentry ** Sons of the Desert ** The Warren Brothers |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Single of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Song of the Year |- | valign="top" | * "Hurt" — Johnny Cash (posthumously awarded) **"Beer For My Horses" — Toby Keith, with Willie Nelson ** "Celebrity" — Brad Paisley ** "Have You Forgotten?" — Darryl Worley ** "Three Wooden Crosses" — Randy Travis | valign="top" | * "Three Wooden Crosses" — Doug Johnson, Kim Williams **"Beer For My Horses" — Toby Keith, Scotty Emerick ** "Celebrity" — Brad Paisley ** "Have You Forgotten?" — Darryl Worley, Wynn Varble ** "Red Dirt Road" — Kix Brooks, Ronnie Dunn |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Horizon Award ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Musician of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Joe Nichols ** Gary Allan ** Buddy Jewell ** Blake Shelton ** Darryl Worley | valign="top" | * Randy Scruggs, Guitar **Jerry Douglas, Dobro ** Paul Franklin, Steel Guitar ** Aubrie Haynie, Fiddle/Mandolin ** Brent Mason, Guitar |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Video of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Event of the Year |- | valign="top" | * "Hurt" — Johnny Cash (posthumously awarded) ** "Beer For My Horses" — Toby Keith and Willie Nelson ** "Celebrity" — Brad Paisley ** "Concrete Angel" — Martina McBride ** "Red Dirt Road" — Brooks & Dunn | valign="top" | * "It's Five O'Clock Somewhere"— Alan Jackson and Jimmy Buffett ** "Beer For My Horses" —Toby Keith and Willie Nelson, ** "Picture" — Kid Rock (feat. Sheryl Crow) ** "Tears in the Holston River" — Nitty Gritty Dirt Band and Johnny Cash (posthumously nominated) ** "The Truth About Men" — Tracy Byrd, Andy Griggs, Montgomery Gentry, and Blake Shelton |} == References == Category:Country music awards Country Music Association Category:American country music CMA Country Music Association Awards Category:Country Music Association Awards Category:November 2003 events in the United States
